Subject: Time Management
Description: How to work, enjoy your hobbies, and still sleep.  Speakers include:Hannah Davis

Subject: How To Be Civilized Online
Description: The internet allows us to express our opinions, good and bad, anonymously and instantaneously.  Learn how to be a better cyber-citizen.  Speakers include:Mitchell Bowling, John Belden

Subject: Whose Geek Are You Anyway?
Description: Come join in some geeky 'Whose Line Is It Anyway' style hijinks!  PG-13 content to be expected, fun for everyone!  Get ready to laugh and have ideas of things you'd like to do, or see others do!  Speakers include:Derek Newland

Subject: Staying Fit On The Go
Description: Join us on a discussion about different ways to stay healthy and active no matter where you are. Topics will also include things you can do right now during the convention.  Speakers include:William E. Bowen

Subject: Social Skills in a Digital Age
Description: Flirting, dating, making friends, influencing people, even simple conversation, all of these things tend to get harder in real life, even as our online inter-connectedness increases! We're here to talk about simple, fun and easy ways to help your IRL social interactions be more LOL and less STFU.  Speakers include:Mitch 'Duckman' Peters, Jennifer Reisbig, Katherine Hatfield Nix

Subject: When Being 'On' is What People Expect
Description: A panel where Mark Oshiro (Mark Does Stuff) and Tanya DePass (I Need Diverse Games) speak about the performative aspects of their work, including the need to entertain while doing blind reads and reactions to media and for Tanya; while streaming on Twitch/YT Gaming.  Speakers include:Tanya DePass, Mark Oshiro

Subject: Financial Planning
Description: As much as we might want to avoid it, we're slowing becoming adults with adult responsibilites.  We can all use advice on money management and planning for our future.  Speakers include:Ericka S. Kahler

Subject: Friendship at the Speed of Sound
Description: This is a speed friending event where participants will pair up and get to know one another with the hopes of finding a Con Buddy.  We'll have questions to keep the conversation going!  Speakers include:Jessica Roland

Subject: LGBTQ* Alphabet Soup
Description: An educational take on the different terms used within the LGBTQ* community. We'll start from basic terms and work our way through some not so common terms.  Speakers include:Cassy Sinke, Alison Chan, Kelly Vanderwell

Subject: Sleeping on the Job: Why (and How) to Catch That Daytime Nap
Description: In just 20 minutes, a nap can make us happier, more energetic and more focused -- so why is it so hard to get one at work, even at an office job? Long-term tech worker and polyphasic sleeper Marie explores the pros and cons, the surprising politics, and the nitty-gritty how-to of getting a nap during your daily grind.  Speakers include:Marie Staver

Subject: Eric S. Raymond 'Ask Me Anything!'
Description: Eric S. Raymond answers your questions about anything!  Speakers include:Eric S. Raymond

Subject: Flirting for Geeks
Description: Come learn how (and how not) to flirt from some of our local fandom's biggest flirts. Not only is it laugh-out-loud funny, it's an irreverent and honest reflection of love, sex, and fandom. Find ways to woo, methods for making friends, and how to have a good time without making others uncomfortable.  Speakers include:Nuri Gocay, Bob Waltenspiel, Dave Phillips, Scott Kennedy, Marie Staver, Jessica Roland, Mark Oshiro

Subject: JAC3D G33K Fitness Bootcamp
Description: A heart pumping, high adrenaline full body training experience designed to trim and sculpt you for the hot months a head.  Includes strength training using various options including body weight, resistance bands to the keep the body guessing along with cardio intervals to maximize calories burned.  This training session will also be accompanied by some of the greatest video game and nerd core music.  Speakers include:William E. Bowen

Subject: How to Poison Your Muse: The Toxic Twins of Talent and Art
Description: We'll discuss how common ideas about talent and art sabotage our creativity. What are these traps, and how can we avoid them? A discussion for artists, authors, musicians, and anyone else who wants to create good stuff.  Speakers include:Paul Kemner, Michael Cieslak

Subject: Poly and Kids
Description: An open discussion about the challenges, the joys and the judgement of raising kids in a poly environment.    Speakers include:Jillian Hawkins, Darek Hawkins, David Case

Subject: Bringing Sci-Fi into the Everyday: Augmented reality in a Children's Hospital
Description: Featured Guest Christina York tells us about one company's mission to put augmented reality (AR) technology to good use, highlighting some inspirational sci-fi moments and then describe how they are taking AR out of the movies and creating moments of wonder and joy for kids in hospital.   Speakers include:Christina York

Subject: Queer: Identity, Sexuality and Beyond
Description: Queer means so many thing to so many people: gender identity, orientation, even a political statement of who you are. Let's talk about the range of identities that fall under the queer label.  Speakers include:Jen Schwartz, Matt Sweet, Max Issac, Allison Demars, Ryan Souder

Subject: A Panel on Paneling
Description: In this mayhem fueled panel, Daniel Dugan will demonstrate everything that could possibly go wrong during a panel. Expect a few laughs, awkward pauses, loaded questions and general mischief.  Speakers include:Daniel Dugan, Rathbone the Pirate

Subject: How Will Technology Change Society?
Description: How we develop our technology may determine the world we will have in the future. Will it be a world of increasing personal freedom, or a totalitarian dystopia? And are we making that decision right now without knowing it?  Speakers include:Deb Nicholson, Jason Mars, Lingjia Tang, Tobias S. Buckell, Edward L. Platt

Subject: Conclave 40 Feedback and Announcements
Description: It's the 40th year for the Conclave SF convention in October, and we want to hear from you!  Find out what is going on in Conclave, bring us your ideas and thoughts, and contribute to the growth of the convention.  We hope to see everyone there and expect big things this year with plenty of surprises!  Speakers include:Anthony Distel

Subject: Party Planning
Description: Whether it's a formal dinner or gaming night, how to prepare for, run, and still enjoy your get-together.  Speakers include:Wendy Carson, Mitchell Bowling, Hannah Davis

Subject: ConFusion ConCom Meeting
Description: Join the 2017 ConFusion concom for a sneak peek at what might be in store for next January at out sister con!  Speakers include:ConFusion ConCom

Subject: The Lighter Side of Poly
Description: Do you want to talk about the difference between primary and secondary partners, negotiations, and the drama and heartache that comes with polyamorous relationships? Well, then, this panel is not for you! We're here to talk about all the good, fun times you can have in an open relationship, when you love more than one person. We'll laugh, we'll joke, and maybe remind people why they're poly after all!  Speakers include:Mitch 'Duckman' Peters, Jennifer Reisbig, Katherine Hatfield Nix

Subject: Surviving a Nuclear Holocaust
Description: This presentation will focus on how to survive, and maybe even thrive, after a nuclear event, be it a nuclear plant accident, a 'dirty bomb' or a nuclear attack, The presentation will involve practical applications of radiation detection instrumentation, contamination and radiation control measures, why the fear of radiation exposure is overblown, and long term strategies for thriving when others have failed.  Speakers include:David J. Newland

Subject: The 10 Commandments of Networking
Description: Networking is the key to moving your career forward. Whether you know it or not, whether you want to admit it or not, others have a huge say in where you go and what you do career wise. The co-founders of IT in the D have created the 10 Commandments of Networking to keep it simple and easy to understand. With more than 2000 hires from their (completely free to attendees) events, they know a little bit about what they're saying.  Speakers include:Dave Phillips, Bob Waltenspiel

Subject: Geek Cred: How to Be a Better Geek
Description: Fandom should bring people together, not be used as a cudgel.  How can the geek community become more inclusive?  Speakers include:Wendy Carson

Subject: Polyamory 201
Description: So, you've figured out that you should communicate, and you know what jealousy is.  What next?  Come together with those of us who have been at this a while and discuss some more advanced polyamory topics such as introducing new polyfolk into an established poly network, dealing with life changes within the poly network, trying the things we tell newbies not to try, and more.  Speakers include:Susan Sons, Adam Nuwer

Subject: How To Actually Relax
Description: Relaxing (we propose) may be the most important skill in all of life: It improves health, focus, strength, balance, empathy and happiness; it eases suffering both mental and physical; it's key to winning at physical combat...it is even the single best thing you can do if you're suddenly thrown from a moving vehicle.  But...do you really know how to do it?  Can you mentally find and ease tension in your mind and body?  In this class, Chinese Internal martial artist and all-around movement junkie Marie will teach the how (and why!) of actively, purposefully relaxing.  Speakers include:Marie Staver

Subject: Ethical Dating
Description: A dating, relationships and friendship panel that just happens to talk about people in IT. The title comes from Ethical Hacking and Dating, whether you find people on dating sites, in the outside world or referred to by a family or friend. This panel will talk about basic tips and tricks on how to meet people, network and date.  Speakers include:Ian Sterrett, Jeremy Myers

Subject: Engineer's Guide to Self Defense
Description: Open to everyone!  Come learn or contribute easy ways to add to your self defense skills using simple principles of leverage and movement!  There will be waivers that need to be signed to participate, and everyone is welcome to do so - Minors need parental accompaniment in order to do so.  Speakers include:Derek Newland

Subject: Gender and Geek Culture
Description:
How do we eliminate the 'women aren't real [fill in the blank] sterotype?  Are we doing everything we can to bring more people into the geek fold?  May also include discussion on transgender and gender-fluid fans.
  Speakers include:Wendy Carson, Hannah Davis, John Belden

Subject: Is It Necessary to Unplug to Unwind?
Description: We have all heard the advice about taking time to remove ourselves from our digital devices, but is that really necessary?  Can one utilize technology to relax after a long day of using technology?  Speakers include:Mitchell Bowling

Subject: Crowd- & Alternatively Funding Your Career
Description: Our panelists discuss their experiences using entrepreneurship opportunities like Startup Weekend and Global Startup Battle or crowdfunding platforms like Kickstarter and Patreon, to supplement or make a living, or start a new project.  Speakers include:Tanya DePass, Mark Oshiro, Christina York, Rinoa Page

Subject: LGBTQ Identities
Description: Let's talk about LGBQT identities  Speakers include:Jen Schwartz, Matt Sweet, Max Issac, Mari Brighe, Allison Demars, Ryan Souder

Subject: Life-ing Your Game
Description: You've heard of hacking your life, maybe you've heard of gaming your life. But how much attention do you pay to what the game you're already playing is teaching you? Third try is a charm (I hope) for this panel where I will attempt to impart to you some of the things that I've learned from my gaming experiences and things that I think you and your children could learn too. Please join me and see what we can learn together.  Speakers include:Craig Hibbard

Subject: Backcountry Camping
Description: Camping can be something besides a place to park your RV.  Learn about what it takes to go someplace where your phone has no signal. How to eat, how to sleep, how to stay warm and dry.  Where you can go within an easy drive from metro Detroit.  We'll  also discuss some of the reasons why you might want to head into the back country.  Speakers include:Clay Dowling

Subject: Raising Kind and Conscious Kids
Description: With so many influences in our kids' lives, how to we give them the tools to make kind and conscious decisions both for themselves and in how they treat and interact with others?  How do we help them to understand and navigate the subtle pressures of the media, their peers, other adults?  How do we help them understand that intent isn't magic, and fair does not always mean equitable?  Speakers include:Elizabeth 'Biz' Nidjam, Jen Talley, Ruth Suehle

Subject: Post Capitalism
Description: Capitalism worked. The reason it's stalling is that its job is successfully finished: the job of efficient supply. But not demand. Universal employment is no longer needed; but with decreased employment, wages go down; therefore there are too few customers to buy products & services. Basic Income is gaining bipartisan support. Replace means-tested benefits with a monthly payment, distributed in the same amount to every citizen, pegged to productivity to stay ahead of inflation. Stop paying a bureaucracy to determine who needs or deserves social assistance. Income inequality is not just an ethical issue. The existence of a large middle class is the only way to keep the economy going.  Speakers include:Matt Arnold, Edward L. Platt, Kevin O'Brien, Zach Blagg, Dana Nelson (Moderator)

Subject: BoF: What Will Penguicon Look Like in 2020?
Description: Let's get together to talk about the future of Penguicon. What will it look like in 2020? Your autonomous, electric car drops you off at the convention and you are automatically registered, with payment taken from your Penguicash account. Then what? Does hospitality have a list of you favorite foods that are dropped in by drone? Is a custom costume cut for you based on prior appearances and the movies you attended that year? Let's use our scifi interest to tell the future. Birds of a feather events are unmoderated.  Speakers include:

Subject: Sharing an Oral History: The Art of Verbal Storytelling
Description: We've all been there: this absolutely amazing thing happened to you yesterday and you want to share it with your friends and family. You take a deep breath and begin...only to helplessly watch as the story falls directly on its face. Storytelling is an art, and like any art it takes practice, study, and one of those books where you draw Sparky the turtle on the grid then mail it to Pueblo CO. This panel will basically be the turtle grid.  Speakers include:Jer Lance, Dawn Kuczwara

Subject: Beyond the Binary
Description: Let's look into our own personal identities beyond the gender binary.  Speakers include:Jen Schwartz, Matt Sweet, Max Issac, Allison Demars, Ryan Souder

Subject: Furries!
Description: What is being a furry all about? Find out about your fuzzy friends. Anthropomorphic Characters, Art, & Costumes  Speakers include:Gnora Ford-Lepthien

Subject: The 10 Commandments of Job Search
Description: The 10 Commandments of Job Search (along with the 7 Deadly Sins) was created at the request of attendees of prior sessions in order to best help them find a job. They're directly related to, but not identical at ALL to, the 10 Commandments of Networking.  Speakers include:Dave Phillips, Bob Waltenspiel
